alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:53AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Nelson and Hardin Counties. .Heavy rain from the past 48 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 32.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 35.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 35.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.8 feet on 11/08/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
